title: Provides that tuition paid to public institutions of higher education shall be maintained in a separate account to be used only for higher education purposes
summary: Provides that tuition paid to public institutions of higher education shall be maintained in a separate account to be used only for higher education purposes.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring that tuition
         paid  for  public  higher education be used for the purposes of higher
         education

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 355 of the education law is amended by adding a new
    2  subdivision 4-a to read as follows:
    3    4-A.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF LAW TO THE CONTRARY, ALL MONEYS
    4  AND REVENUE DERIVED FROM THE  PAYMENT  OF  TUITION  AT  ANY  COLLEGE  OR
    5  UNIVERSITY OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK SHALL BE DEPOSITED IN AND
    6  CREDITED  TO  A  SEPARATE  ACCOUNT.  THE MONEYS IN SUCH ACCOUNT SHALL BE
    7  EXPENDED SOLELY FOR THE FUNDING OF PUBLIC  HIGHER  EDUCATION.  UNDER  NO
    8  CIRCUMSTANCE  SHALL  THE  MONEYS  IN SUCH ACCOUNT BE COMMINGLED WITH ANY
    9  OTHER MONEYS.
